vcat reference no. j210/2006 fair trading act 1999 s.107 ; doubt that consumer and trader dispute extends to defamation associated with consumer and trader dispute; finding no defamation. fair trading act 1999 s.108 ; consumer and trader dispute; professional negligence claim by client against legal practitioner; client ordered to pay costs of interlocutory application in federal court proceedings; practitioner negligent in failing to obtain instructions promptly, failing to warn client about delay, and in failing to withdraw brief from equivocating counsel in sufficient time to avoid costs order; compensation awarded.

citances.sentence: Evidence was given by Mr. Jonathan Brett of counsel, who appeared for Mr. Coggin at the trial of the Federal Court proceedings. Mr. Brett said that he came into the matter shortly prior to the trial, and that there was a need at that stage for the preparation of statements of witnesses. Mr. Brett also said that the evidence of a Christine McIlwee was important to Mr. Coggin's case. That is confirmed by the decision of Heerey J in the Federal Court: see Coggin v Telstar Finance Company (Q) Pty Ltd [2006] FCA 191 @ [20] to [25].
